job_title: Lead Graphic Designer in Saint Louis, MO
pros: This is by far one of my best work experiences I've ever had. I've worked for the Center for Student Engagement as a Lead Graphic Designer for almost two years and it's been awesome. The management is great and my coworkers are all so nice and helpful. This place allowed for me to grow professionally as well! The hours were really flexible as well as they understood that I'm a student who needs to balance school and work!
cons: Since it's only a work-study job, unfortunately students cannot keep their jobs after graduation. Otherwise, I'd totally continue to work here after graduation if I could!

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Management sets goals, and is willing to put in the funds and support to make it happen.  The campus community is very supportive and welcoming.
cons: Management is so focused on the students, they have left the faculty and staff behind.  Maryville used to be a top place to work for in St. Louis.  Having that title doesn't matter to the president of the university anymore.

job_title: Online Adjunct Professor in Saint Louis Park, MN
pros: Decent pay, easy to get hired, seems like a good company culture.
cons: The courses are an absolute mess in the Humanities and you are expected to use them, or else, no management guidance, no training. Half the students are failing and not participating in the course.

review_title: Care very little about the faculty, they are an expendable commodity who live in fear of the president.
job_title: Assistant Professor in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Some strong academic programs with good faculty members.  Nice campus and location.  Rated highly by US News and Kiplingers.
cons: Lack of support for faculty.  Fear of administration which has overtaken campus.  Has difficulty trying to identify what it wants to be.  Do we want to be online, face to face.  Will exploit every means possible to make a dollar from the students and faculty.

job_title: Assistant Professor in Saint Louis, MO
pros: It's a fast-paced, ever-changing environment. There's never a dull moment. Students and colleagues are amazing and every day it feels like you are surrounded by a close network of friends and family.
cons: It's fast-paced given the general changes happening across higher ed. We are staying on top, or ahead of that curve, so it generally results in some headaches as the kinks are ironed out. Worth it.

job_title: Team Leader in Saint Louis, MO
pros: The students, faculty and staff are what kept me coming year after year. It's the best educational institutions I would highly recommend to all.
cons: The swift change  in the institution and not seeing people like I did when I had ownership in a certain area is an adjustment.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Louis, MO
pros: I liked working directly with the students and faculty in helping along the educational process. I found most of the staff really wanting to work and have a family atmosphere.
cons: You cannot diverge in thought from administration, especially the president, or face dismissal. When technology changes I was unable to take the time or given the opportunity to learn new technologies beyond normal working hours.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Saint Louis, MO
pros: The flexibility of teaching online is a definite benefit.
cons: The school has grown its online presence so much that it now feels like the University of Phoenix or other type of for-profit higher education entity.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Supportive staff and Faculty creates a wonderful and rewarding teaching experience.  Facilities are first rate.
cons: Work schedules are sometime irregular.
